channel.title: Whonix devel mailing list false positive spam detection
channel.description:
The Whonix devel maling list has been getting this kind of spam detection for quiet a while:
> Spam detection software, running on the system "whonix.org", > has identified this incoming email as possible spam. The original > message has been attached to this so you can view it or label > similar future email. If you have any questions, see > @@CONTACT_ADDRESS@@ for details.
The problem is not urgent since we can still see emails from the attachments. But it is better if there is a way to fix it.
Maybe white-listing all the emails sent from blackhole at torproject dot org?

item.title: Whonix devel mailing list false positive spam detection
item.dc:creator: iry
item.description:
fortasse:

I turned down the rules I put in when there was some new botnet throwing out a bunch of Russian-language spam. This should be less of an issue - unless the message is actually spam.

Sounds great! Thank you so much for your long time awesome work and
effort, @fortasse !

Read full topic
item.source: Whonix devel mailing list false positive spam detection

item.title: Whonix devel mailing list false positive spam detection
item.dc:creator: iry
item.description:
The Whonix devel maling list has been getting this kind of spam detection for quiet a while:

Spam detection software, running on the system “whonix.org”,
has identified this incoming email as possible spam. The original
message has been attached to this so you can view it or label
similar future email. If you have any questions, see
@@CONTACT_ADDRESS@@ for details.

The problem is not urgent since we can still see emails from the attachments. But it is better if there is a way to fix it.

Maybe white-listing all the emails sent from blackhole at torproject dot org?

Read full topic
item.source: Whonix devel mailing list false positive spam detection
